newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev eases to 223-225 per dollar at close.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev eases to 223-225 per dollar at close.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev eased to 223-225 per dollar from 221-223 in the morning due to a slight rise in dollar demand in the afternoon when the central bank stopped being active on the interbank market, dealers said.
"(Foreign currency) demand picked up slightly in the afternoon when the central bank has already withdrawn from the market and the lev dipped to 223-225 at the close,' one dealer said.
Due to dollar supply by the central bank at 221-222 levs and the moderate demand the lev traded stable between 222 and 223.50 to the dollar by midday, traders said.
According to some dealers the central bank was selling dollars to a number of banks, offering volumes between $100,000-$200,000 to each of them.
BNB officials were not immediately available for comment.
Dealers said they expected the lev to weaken to 227-228 to the dollar tomorrow due to the longer period to value date of Thursday's spot deals. -- Anastas Petrov, Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
